body_html:
Ok,

/usr/lib/python2.7/plat-x86_64-linux-gnu/_sysconfigdata_nd.py has the entry:

'CONFIGURE_CFLAGS': '-Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security',

that's where the -Wdata-time flag comes from. This is a Ubuntu 16.04 system.

I tested the compilation with GCC 4.8 on openSUSE 42.3 and it worked.

that's where the -Wdata-time flag comes from. This is a Ubuntu 16.04 system.
I tested the compilation with GCC 4.8 on openSUSE 42.3 and it worked.
body:
Ok,

`/usr/lib/python2.7/plat-x86_64-linux-gnu/_sysconfigdata_nd.py` has the entry:

```ini
'CONFIGURE_CFLAGS': '-Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security',
```
that's where the `-Wdata-time` flag comes from. This is a Ubuntu 16.04 system.

I tested the compilation with GCC 4.8 on openSUSE 42.3 and it worked.
